intro: Solenotus rariflorus, commonly known as the rare-flowered solenotus, is a small herbaceous plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, clustered leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, with five petals and are borne in dense inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Solenotus rariflorus is considered a rare and endangered species.
